title: TP53 missense variants drive colorectal cancer progression
abstract: Mutations such as R175H in TP53 are enriched in colorectal tumors and correlate with poor prognosis and chemoresistance.

title: BRCA1 frameshift 185delAG and hereditary breast cancer
abstract: The 185delAG frameshift mutation in BRCA1 disrupts DNA repair, leading to genomic instability and a marked increase in hereditary breast cancer risk.

title: EGFR exon 19 deletions predict NSCLC response to TKIs
abstract: Patients with NSCLC harboring EGFR exon 19 deletions demonstrate prolonged progression-free survival when treated with tyrosine kinase inhibitors like erlotinib.

title: KRAS G12D mutation drives pancreatic tumorigenesis
abstract: Using murine models, KRAS G12D mutations were shown to be sufficient to initiate pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia and progression to invasive cancer.

title: ALK fusion proteins in pediatric anaplastic large cell lymphoma
abstract: NPM-ALK fusion proteins drive oncogenesis in pediatric ALCL through constitutive kinase activity and STAT3 pathway activation, highlighting targets for therapy.

title: PTEN loss enhances PI3K/AKT signaling in glioblastoma
abstract: PTEN-deficient glioblastoma cells show increased proliferation due to unregulated PI3K/AKT signaling, implicating pathway inhibitors as viable treatments.

title: CFTR F508del correction in cystic fibrosis organoids
abstract: Corrector-potentiator combinations restored chloride conductance in patient-derived organoids with F508del CFTR, supporting ex vivo modeling of therapeutic efficacy.

title: APC truncation mutations and WNT activation in colorectal tumors
abstract: Truncated APC proteins fail to degrade β-catenin, resulting in constitutive WNT pathway activation and promotion of tumor growth in colorectal tissue.

title: IDH1 R132H mutation alters glioma epigenome
abstract: The R132H mutation in IDH1 produces 2-hydroxyglutarate, causing widespread DNA hypermethylation and altering gene expression profiles in gliomas.

title: MLH1 promoter methylation in Lynch syndrome colorectal cancers
abstract: Promoter methylation of MLH1 silences mismatch repair activity in Lynch-associated colorectal cancers, leading to microsatellite instability and higher mutational burden.
